actor_awards.notes: A pioneer of American television sketch comedy, known for 'Your Show of Shows'. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960 and the TCA Career Achievement Award in 1986.

filmography.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
filmography.role_description: A neurotic dentist who gets caught up in a chaotic cross-country race to find a buried fortune.
filmography.plot: A dying thief reveals the location of stolen cash to a group of strangers, sparking a chaotic cross-country race to find the loot.

filmography.title: Grease
filmography.role_description: The tough-talking but well-meaning sports coach at Rydell High School.
filmography.plot: Good girl Sandy and greaser Danny fell in love over the summer. When they unexpectedly discover they're now in the same high school, will they be able to rekindle their romance?
filmography.awards: People's Choice Award: Win – Favorite Motion Picture

filmography.title: Silent Movie
filmography.role_description: The frantic head of a movie studio who is threatened by a corporate takeover.
filmography.plot: A film director and his friends try to save a movie studio by making a silent movie with big stars.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: History of the World, Part I
filmography.role_description: The leader of the cavemen in the Stone Age segment of Mel Brooks' comedy anthology.
filmography.plot: Mel Brooks brings his one-of-a-kind comic touch to the history of mankind covering events from the Old Testament to the French Revolution.

filmography.title: Tars and Spars
filmography.role_description: A Coast Guard sailor who does a hilarious routine imitating a movie war plane. Caesar's film debut.
filmography.plot: A sailor in the Coast Guard wants to see combat action but is assigned to a show on base.

filmography.title: Airport 1975
filmography.role_description: A passenger on the stricken 747 who provides comic relief during the disaster.
filmography.plot: A 747 in flight collides with a small plane, and the pilots are incapacitated, leaving a stewardess to fly the plane.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Most Promising Newcomer (Helen Reddy)

filmography.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
filmography.role_description: A nightclub comedian who is one of the survivors visited by the widow Janet Ames.
filmography.plot: A war widow seeks out the five men her husband died saving to see if they were worth the sacrifice.

filmography.title: Grease 2
filmography.role_description: Reprising his role as the high school coach in this musical sequel.
filmography.plot: A new English exchange student tries to win the heart of the leader of the Pink Ladies by becoming a cool biker.

filmography.title: The Cheap Detective
filmography.role_description: A parody of the character Joel Cairo from 'The Maltese Falcon'.
filmography.plot: A spoof of Bogart movies in which a detective tries to find his partner's killer and a missing fortune in diamonds.

filmography.title: Ten from Your Show of Shows
filmography.role_description: A theatrical compilation film featuring ten of the best sketches from Caesar's legendary TV series.
filmography.plot: A collection of classic sketches from the 1950s television variety program 'Your Show of Shows'.

filmography.title: A Guide for the Married Man
filmography.role_description: One of many celebrity cameos offering advice on infidelity in this comedy.
filmography.plot: A man who loves his wife but is bored with his marriage receives lessons on how to have an affair from his best friend.

filmography.title: The Busy Body
filmography.role_description: A gangster involved in a mix-up over a suit lined with a million dollars.
filmography.plot: A mobster is ordered to help dig up a body to retrieve a fortune in cash sewn into the lining of the deceased's suit.

filmography.title: Cannonball Run II
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance in the star-studded sequel to the hit racing comedy.
filmography.plot: The original characters from the first movie race across the country again in a high-speed car rally.
filmography.awards: Golden Raspberry Award: Nomination – Worst Actor (Burt Reynolds)

filmography.title: Vegas Vacation
filmography.role_description: An old man playing Keno in Las Vegas who interacts with the Griswold family.
filmography.plot: The Griswold family heads to Las Vegas for a vacation, where Clark gets addicted to gambling and the family drifts apart.

filmography.title: The Wonderful Ice Cream Suit
filmography.role_description: A tailor who sells a magical white suit to a group of men.
filmography.plot: Five men who have nothing in common chip in to buy a beautiful white suit that makes their dreams come true.

filmography.title: The Spirit of '76
filmography.role_description: A character in this spoof of American history and patriotism.
filmography.plot: A comedic look at the American Revolution and the drafting of the Constitution.

filmography.title: Fire Sale
filmography.role_description: An eccentric uncle in a chaotic family comedy directed by Alan Arkin.
filmography.plot: A Jewish basketball coach needs money to adopt a tall teenager, while his father plans to burn down the family store for insurance money.

filmography.title: The Fiendish Plot of Dr. Fu Manchu
filmography.role_description: An FBI agent in Peter Sellers' final film.
filmography.plot: Dr. Fu Manchu's 168th birthday celebration is dampened by the theft of the elixir of life, which he needs to survive.

filmography.title: Barnaby and Me
filmography.role_description: A con man who gets involved with a girl and her talking koala bear.
filmography.plot: A con artist on the run in Australia befriends a woman and her pet koala, who he discovers can talk.

filmography.title: Curse of the Pink Panther
filmography.role_description: A mafia boss who tries to eliminate the bumbling detective Clifton Sleigh.
filmography.plot: A bumbling American detective is hired to find the missing Inspector Clouseau, unaware that he was hired because he is expected to fail.

filmography.title: Over the Brooklyn Bridge
filmography.role_description: The rich, traditional uncle who holds the loan for the protagonist's restaurant over his head.
filmography.plot: A Jewish restaurant owner in Brooklyn dreams of opening a Manhattan eatery, but needs to borrow money from his overbearing uncle.

filmography.title: Freedom Road
filmography.role_description: The narrator of this historical drama starring Muhammad Ali. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A former slave is elected to the U.S. Senate during the Reconstruction era in 1870s Virginia.

filmography.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
filmography.role_description: The vain Emperor who is tricked into wearing invisible clothes.
filmography.plot: A musical adaptation of the classic Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale about a vain ruler and two swindlers.

filmography.title: Stoogemania
filmography.role_description: A doctor who tries to cure a man obsessed with the Three Stooges.
filmography.plot: A Three Stooges fanatic is committed to a sanitarium where he attempts to cure his obsession.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: A mythical creature who befriends Alice and the Mock Turtle in this star-studded TV movie.
filmography.plot: Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar anthropomorphic creatures.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Costume Design
